d:entry.d:title: (front/back matter)
d:entry.p: Based on the word lists from the Logical Language Group of the 1990s

ul.li: x1 utters verbally/says/phonates/speaks [vocally makes sound] x2

d:entry.p: also voices; does not necessarily imply communication or audience; ('says' is usually cusku)]; (cf. krixa, cusku, casnu, tavla, voksa, pinka)

ul.li: x1 is a banana/plantain [fruit/plant] of species/breed x2
x1 is sad/depressed/dejected/[unhappy/feels sorrow/grief] about x2 (abstraction)

d:entry.p: cf. klaku, gleki, betri, cinmo, junri)

ul.li: x1 runs on surface x2 using limbs x3 with gait x4

d:entry.p: cf. cadzu, klama, litru, stapa, plipe, cpare)

ul.li: x1 is a bundle/package/cluster/clump/pack [shape/form] containing x2, held together by x3
x1 is a cow/cattle/kine/ox/[bull/steer/calf] [beef-producer/bovine] of species/breed x2
x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of chalk from source x2 in form x3
x1 is a bucket/pail/can/deep, solid, wide-topped container of contents x2, made of material x3

d:entry.p: cf. botpi, patxu, tansi, lante, lanka)

ul.li: x1 is a bulb [body-part] of plant/species x2
[metaphor: rounded, bulgy]
x1 is a balcony/overhang/ledge/shelf of building/structure x2
x1 is a blade of tool/weapon x2

d:entry.p: cf. dakfu, tunta, tutci, guska, kinli, katna)

ul.li: x1 is in the future of/later than/after x2 in time sequence
x1 is latter
x2 is former

d:entry.p: also sequel, succeed, successor, follow, come(s) after; time ordering only (use lidne otherwise); aorist in that x1 may overlap in time with x2 as long as it extends afterwards; non-aorist future (= cfabalvi); (default x2 is the space time reference, whereupon:) x1 will occur]; (cf. lidne, cabna, purci, farna)

ul.li: x1 exceeds/is beyond limit/boundary x2 from x3 in property/amount x4 (ka/ni)

d:entry.p: on the other side of a bound, but not necessarily directly 'across' nor at the shortest plausible distance (per ragve); also not limited to position in space]; (cf. dukse, ragve, zmadu, kuspe)

ul.li: x1 (event) defends/protects x2 (object/state) from threat/peril/potential x3 (event)

d:entry.p: also secures (verb); x1 wards/resists x3; protective cover/shield (= badgai)]; (cf. ckape, fanta, fapro, marbi, rivbi, zunti, snura, binra, lunbe, pulji)

ul.li: x1 is an amphibian of species/breed x2
x1 is a/the language/dialect used by x2 to express/communicate x3 (si&apos
o/du&apos
u, not quote)

d:entry.p: also tongue]; (cf. tance, cusku, ve tavla, valsi, gerna, jufra, natmi, slaka)

ul.li: x1 is great/grand in property x2 (ka) by standard x3

d:entry.p: indicates a subjective greatness, as compared to the objective standard implied for barda; (synonyms, possibly requiring tanru:) extraordinary, illustrious, magnificent, impressive, awesome, grandiose, august, inspiring, special, majestic, distinguished, eminent, splendor, stately, imposing (all generally zabna); terrible (mabla)]; (cf. barda, nobli, se sinma, pluja, misno, vajni, fasnu, cizra, traji, mutce, se manci)

ul.li: x1 grows/expands [an increasing development] to size/into form x2 from x3

d:entry.p: also rising, developing; x1 gets bigger/enlarges/increases]; (cf. farvi, zenba, jmina, barda, makcu, ferti)

ul.li: x1 is a bank owned by/in banking system x2 for banking function(s) x3 (event)
x1 (object) suffices/is enough/sufficient for purpose x2 under conditions x3

d:entry.p: cf. dukse, claxu, nitcu, ricfu, curmi)

ul.li: x1 [force] (ka) forces/compels event x2 to occur
x1 determines property x2 to manifest

d:entry.p: also constrains; requires success, unlike the physics term (better expressed by danre)]; (cf. fanta, rinju, jimte, jitro, rinka, krinu, zukte, randa, danre, cmavo list bai, marxa, tinsa, xarnu)

ul.li: x1 is big/large in property/dimension(s) x2 (ka) as compared with standard/norm x3

d:entry.p: cf. banli, clani, ganra, condi, plana, cmalu, rotsu, banro, xanto)

ul.li: x1 arches/curves over/around x2 and is made of x3
x1 is an arch over/around x2 of material x3

d:entry.p: also arc; x2 need not be an object, but may be a point or volume]; (cf. cripu, kruvi, korcu, condi)

ul.li: x1 is a tavern/bar/pub serving x2 to audience/patrons x3

d:entry.p: cf. gusta, birje, jikru, sanmi, vanju, xotli, ckafi, se pinxe)

ul.li: x1(s) is a/are mark(s)/spot(s) on x2 of material x3

d:entry.p: ba'armo'a for a pattern of marks]; (cf. sinxa, pixra, se ciska, se prina)

ul.li: x1 is on the outside of x2
x1 is exterior to x2

d:entry.p: cf. jibni, nenri, sruri, lamji, korbi, calku, vasru)

ul.li: x1 emphasizes/accentuates/gives emphasis/stress/accent to x2 by (action) x3
x1 replaces/substitutes for/instead of x2 in circumstance x3
x1 is a replacement/substitute

d:entry.p: also: x1 trades places with x2]; (cf. cmavo list ba'i, binra)

ul.li: x1 bites/pinches x2 on/at specific locus x3 with x4

d:entry.p: bite through (= ka'arbatci, batygre); pinch (= cinzybatci)]; (cf. denci, jgalu, guska, citka)

ul.li: x1 is a button/knob/[handle] on/for item x2, with purpose x3, made of material x4

d:entry.p: cf. jadni, balji, punji, jgari, lasna)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of barley [grain] of species/strain x2
x1 reflects Malay-Indonesian common language/culture in aspect x2
x1 is foolish/silly in event/action/property [folly] (ka) x2
x1 is a boob
x1 reflects North American culture/nationality/geography in aspect x2
x1 is a crew/team/gang/squad/band of persons x2 directed/led by x3 organized for purpose x4

d:entry.p: x1 is a mass; x2 is a set completely specified); [also orchestra (= zgibe'e, balzgibe'e), outfit; x3 conductor; business, not necessarily incorporated (= cajbe'e, venbe'e)]; (cf. gunma, girzu, dansu, jatna, jitro, kagni, kamni, minde, ralju, cecmu, gidva)

ul.li: x1 reflects Bengali/Bangladesh culture/nationality/language in aspect x2
x1 transfers/sends/transmits x2 to receiver x3 from transmitter/origin x4 via means/medium x5

d:entry.p: also possibly "sharing"; no (complete) alienation from origin is implied]; [x5 carrier]; (cf. muvdu, dunda, mrilu, nirna, xruti, cradi, tivni, preja, cmavo list be'i, bevri, mrilu, tcana)

ul.li: x1 is a son of mother/father/parents x2 [not necessarily biological]

d:entry.p: also filial]; (cf. verba, nanla, nakni, nanmu, patfu, mamta, bruna, rirni, rorci, panzi, tixnu)

ul.li: x1 is to the north/northern side [right-hand-rule pole] of x2 according to frame of reference x
x1 is a/the brain [body-part] of x2
[metaphor: intelligence, mental control]

d:entry.p: also cerebral]; (cf. menli, stedu, rango, pensi)

ul.li: x1 is a/the abdomen/belly/lower trunk [body-part] of x2
[metaphor: midsection]

d:entry.p: also stomach (= djaruntyrango), digestive tract (= befctirango, befctirangyci'e)]; (cf. cutne, livga, canti)

ul.li: x1 is a tragedy/disaster/tragic for x2
x1 carries/hauls/bears/transports cargo x2 to x3 from x4 over path x5
x1 is a carrier/[porter]

d:entry.p: alienation from x2 to x3 is implied]; (cf. marce, muvdu, benji, klama)

ul.li: digit/number: 8 (digit)
non-logical interval connective: unordered between ... and ... (rafsi represents any interval)
x1 is a bead/pebble [shape/form] of material x2
x1 is a bee/wasp/hornet of species/breed x2
x1 whips/lashes/snaps [a sudden violent motion]
x1 is bound/obliged to/has the duty to do/be x2 in/by standard/agreement x3
x1 must do x2

d:entry.p: also x3 frame of reference]; (cf. zifre, fuzme)

ul.li: x1 is ill/sick/diseased with symptoms x2 from disease x3

d:entry.p: cf. kanro, mikce, spita, senci, kafke, binra)

ul.li: x1 is military/regimented/is strongly organized/prepared by system x2 for purpose x3

d:entry.p: also paramilitary; soldier in its broadest sense - not limited to those trained/organized as part of an army to defend a state (= bilpre)]; (cf. jenmi for a military force, sonci, ganzu, pulji)

ul.li: x1 reflects Indonesian culture/nationality/language in aspect x2
x1 insures/indemnifies x2 (person) against peril x3 (event) providing benefit(s) x4 (event)

d:entry.p: also x3 loss; sell/purchase insurance (= binryve'u), premium (= binrydi'a, or binryvelve'u)]; (cf. bandu, cirko, betri, basti, bilma)

ul.li: x1 becomes/changes/converts/transforms into x2 under conditions x3

d:entry.p: resultative, not-necessarily causal, change]; (cf. cenba for non-resultative, galfi for causal, stika for non-resultative, non-causal change; zasni)

ul.li: x1 is made of/contains/is a amount of beer/ale/brew brewed from x2

d:entry.p: cf. pinxe, barja, jikru, vanju, xalka, fusra)

ul.li: x1 is a/the arm [body-part] of x2
[metaphor: branch with strength]

d:entry.p: also elbow (= bircidni), wrist (= xanterjo'e), appendage (but jimca, rebla preferred)]; (cf. jimca, janco, xance, rebla)

ul.li: x1 is certain/sure/positive/convinced that x2 is true

d:entry.p: cf. jetnu, jinvi, krici, djuno, senpi, sruma)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains ice [frozen crystal] of composition/material x2

d:entry.p: composition including x2, which need not be a complete composition]; (cf. kunra, runme, lenku, krili, bratu, snime, carvi)

ul.li: x1 is a wall/fence separating x2 and x3 (unordered) of/in structure x4

d:entry.p: cf. jbini, sepli, fendi, canko, drudi, kumfa, loldi, senta, snuji, pagre, gacri, kuspe, marbi, vorme)

ul.li: x1 is white/very-light colored [color adjective]

d:entry.p: pale forms of other colors are a compound of white; e.g. pink (= labyxu'e, xunblabi) (whereas kandi is used for pale = dimness, lack of intensity)]; (cf. skari, xekri, grusi, kandi, manku, carmi, bakri, blanu, bunre, cicna, crino, narju, nukni, pelxu, xunre, zirpu)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains glass of composition including x2
x1 is blue [color adjective]

d:entry.p: cf. skari, blabi, xekri, zirpu, kandi, carmi, cicna)

ul.li: x1 is a block [3-dimensional shape/form] of material x2, surfaces/sides x3

d:entry.p: x3 sides/surfaces should include number, size, and shape; also polyhedron (= pitybli having flat/planar sides/surfaces)], regular polyhedron (= kubybli, blikubli), brick (= kitybli); (cf. tapla, kubli, tanbo, canlu, kojna, sefta, bolci, kurfa, tarmi)

ul.li: x1 is a boat/ship/vessel [vehicle] for carrying x2, propelled by x3

d:entry.p: cf. falnu, fulta, marce, jatna, sabnu)

ul.li: short scope joiner
joins various constructs with shortest scope and right grouping
x1 is a ball/sphere/orb/globe [shape/form] of material x2
x1 is a spherical object [made of x2

d:entry.p: also round]; (cf. bliku, cukla, bidju, gunro)

ul.li: x1 is a/the bone/ivory [body-part], performing function x2 in body of x3
[metaphor: calcium]

d:entry.p: x2 is likely an abstract: may be structure/support for some body part, but others as well such as the eardrum bones; the former can be expressed as (tu'a le <body-part>); cartilage/gristle (= ranbo'u), skeleton (= bogygreku)]; (cf. greku, denci, jirna, sarji)

ul.li: x1 is a bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container for x2, made of material x3 with lid x4

d:entry.p: cf. baktu, lante, patxu, tansi, tanxe, vasru, gacri)

ul.li: x1 is a sheet/foil/blanket [2-dimensional shape/form flexible in 3 dimensions] of material x2

d:entry.p: cf. plita, cinje, polje, slasi, tinci)

ul.li: x1 is a wave [periodic pattern] in medium x2, wave-form x3, wave-length x4, frequency x5

d:entry.p: cf. slilu, dikni, cinje, polje, morna, canre)

ul.li: x1 is an enemy/opponent/adversary/foe of x2 in struggle x3

d:entry.p: cf. damba, jamna, darlu, pendo, fapro, gunta, sarji, jivna, jinga)

ul.li: x1 is hail/sleet/freezing rain/solid precipitation of material/composition including x2

d:entry.p: this is the substance, not the act or manner of its falling, which is carvi]; (cf. carvi, snime, bisli, tcima)

ul.li: x1 reflects Brazilian culture/nationality/language in aspect x2
x1 is ready/prepared for x2 (event)
x1 (text) is a predicate relationship with relation x2 among arguments (sequence/set) x3

d:entry.p: also: x3 are related by relation x2 (= terbri for reordered places)]; (x3 is a set completely specified); (cf. sumti, fancu)

ul.li: x1 is a breeze/wind/gale from direction x2 with speed x3
x1 blows from x2
x1 is an office/bureau/work-place of worker x2 at location x3
x1 reflects British/United Kingdom culture/nationality in aspect x2
1st assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure)
2nd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure)
3rd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure)
4th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure)
5th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure)
x1 is brother of/fraternal to x2 by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) x3
[not necess. biological]

d:entry.p: cf. mensi, tunba, tamne, famti, bersa)

ul.li: convert any single word to BY
logically quantified predicate variable: some selbri 1
x1 pertains to the Buddhist culture/religion/ethos in aspect x2
x1 is an amount of cloth/fabric of type/material x2

d:entry.p: cf. mapni, matli, sunla, slasi, silka)

ul.li: x1 is foggy/misty/covered by a fog/mist/vapor of liquid x2

d:entry.p: cf. djacu, carvi, danmo, lunsa, tcima, gapci)

ul.li: x1 is x2 (def. 1) local weight unit(s) [non-metric], standard x3, subunits [e.g. ounces] x4

d:entry.p: additional subunit places may be added as x5, x6, ...); (cf. grake, junta, tilju, rupnu, fepni, dekpu, gutci, minli, merli, kramu)

ul.li: x1 is brown/tan [color adjective]

d:entry.p: cf. skari, blabi, xekri, kandi, carmi)

ul.li: x1 is a brush for purpose x2 (event) with bristles x3
x1 is embarrassed/disconcerted/flustered/ill-at-ease about/under conditions x2 (abstraction)
modal aspect: actuality/ongoing event
x1 is current at/in the present of/during/concurrent/simultaneous with x2 in time

d:entry.p: (default x2 is the present resulting in:) x1 is now; time relationship only, 'aorist' claiming simultaneity does not mean one event does not extend into the past or future of the other] (cf. zvati, balvi, purci, cmavo list ca, cmavo list ca'a)

ul.li: x1 is apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment for function x2 controlled/[triggered] by x3 (agent)

d:entry.p: form determined by/from function; does not imply automated/automatic action - requires an external agent/trigger (a minji may be a zmiku cabra if it requires an external agent to trigger or control the functions that it performs automatically)]; (cf. tutci, minji, finti; girzu, ganzu for organizational apparatus, pilno)

ul.li: x1 is x2 hours in duration (default is 1 hour) by standard x3

d:entry.p: cf. junla, mentu, snidu, tcika, temci)

ul.li: x1 walks/strides/paces on surface x2 using limbs x3
x1 (event) often/frequently/commonly/customarily occurs/recurs by standard x2

d:entry.p: cf. rirci, fadni, kampu, rapli, krefu, lakne, cmavo list piso'iroi and similar compounds)

ul.li: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of chocolate/cocoa
x1 is a shell/husk [hard, protective covering] around x2 composed of x3
x1 vanishes/disappears from location x2
x1 ceases to be observed at x2 using senses/sensor x3

d:entry.p: also leaves, goes away (one sense)]; (cf. cliva, ganse, zgana, lebna, vimcu)

ul.li: x1 is idle/at rest/inactive

d:entry.p: "in motion", not implying a change in location, is negation of this]; (cf. surla)

ul.li: x1 is a farm/ranch at x2, farmed by x3, raising/producing x4
(adjective:) x1 is agrarian

d:entry.p: also grange; farming is any organized agrarian activity, not limited to plant crops]; (cf. purdi, nurma, ferti, foldi, xarju)

ul.li: x1 exchanges/trades/barters commodity x2 for x3 with x4
x1, x4 is a trader/merchant/businessma

d:entry.p: also (adjective:) x1, x2, x4 is/are commercial (better expressed as ka canja, kamcanja)]; x2/x3 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (possibly service), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posycanja for unambiguous semantics); (cf. dunda, friti, vecnu, zarci, jdini, pleji, jdima, jerna, kargu; see note at jdima on cost/price/value distinction, banxa, cirko, dunda, janta, kargu, prali, sfasa, zivle)

ul.li: x1 is a window/portal/opening [portal] in wall/building/structure x2

d:entry.p: cf. vorme, bitmu, ganlo, murta, pagre, kevna, jvinu, kalri, kuspe)

ul.li: x1 is space/volume/region/room [at-least-3-dimensional area] occupied by x2

d:entry.p: also occupy (= selca'u)] (cf. kensa, bliku, kumfa, kevna, kunti, tubnu, dekpu)

ul.li: x1 is a shovel/spade [bladed digging implement] for digging x2
x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of sand/grit from source x2 of composition including x3

d:entry.p: also abrasive (= gukcanre)]; (cf. bidju, rokci, zalvi, boxna)

ul.li: x1 is a/the gut(s)/entrails/intestines/viscera/innards/digestive system [body-part] of x2
x1 is a cart/carriage/wagon [wheeled vehicle] for carrying x2, propelled by x3
x1 is intense/bright/saturated/brilliant in property (ka) x2 as received/measured by observer x

d:entry.p: also lustrous, gleaming, sparkling, shining (all probably better metaphorically combined with gusni: gusycai or camgu'i); in colors, refers principally to increased saturation (with opposite kandi)]; (cf. denmi, gusni, kandi, ruble, skari, tilju, tsali, mutce, blabi, blanu, bunre, cicna, crino, grusi, narju, nukni, pelxu, xekri, xunre, zirpu)

ul.li: x1 turns/rotates/revolves around axis x2 in direction x3
x1 is a chart/diagram/map of/about x2 showing formation/data-points x3
x1 rains/showers/[precipitates] to x2 from x3
x1 is precipitation [not limited to &apos
rain&apos

d:entry.p: cf. bratu, dilnu, santa, snime, tcima, bisli, bumru)

ul.li: x1(s) (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo&apos
u possible) discuss(es)/talk(s) about topic/subject x

d:entry.p: also chat, converse]; (cf. bacru, cusku, darlu, tavla)

ul.li: x1 [agent] shoves/pushes x2 at locus x3

d:entry.p: move by pushing/shoving (= ca'ermuvgau)]; (cf. danre for non-agentive force, lacpu)

ul.li: x1 looks at/examines/views/inspects/regards/watches/gazes at x2

d:entry.p: also look through (= grecta, ravycta, bacycta); note that English "look" often means a more generic "observe"]; (cf. jvinu, minra, simlu, viska, lanli, zgana, setca, viska)

ul.li: x1 has authority/is an official in/on/over matter/sphere/persons x2 derived on basis x3

d:entry.p: cf. turni, tutra, krati, cmavo list ca'i, jaspu, pulji)

ul.li: x1 (agent) kills/slaughters/murders x2 by action/method x3
x1 is shallow in extent in direction/property x2 away from reference point x3 by standard x4

d:entry.p: cf. condi, tordu, jarki, cinla, cmalu, jarki, jmifa)

ul.li: non-logical connective: set link, unordered
&quot
and also&quot
, but forming a set
digit/number: % percentage symbol, hundredths
non-logical connective: ordered sequence link
&quot
and then&quot
, forming a sequence
x1 launches/fires/shoots projectile/missile x2, propelled by x3 [propellant/propulsion]

d:entry.p: also: x1 is a gun/launcher/cannon; x1 hurls/throws/casts (more general than renro in that propulsion need not be internal to x1)]; (cf. renro, danti, jakne, jbama, spoja)

ul.li: x1 is a community/colony of organisms x2

d:entry.p: cf. bende, kulnu, natmi, tcadu, jecta, girzu)

ul.li: x1 is an era/epoch/age characterized by x2 (event/property/interval/idea)

d:entry.p: x2 interval should be the defining boundaries; if merely a characterizing period, the nature of the interval should be expressed in an abstract bridi, or the interval should be marked with tu'a; x2 may also be characteristic object(s) or practices of the era, if marked with tu'a); (cf. ranji, temci, citsi)

ul.li: x1 varies/changes in property/quantity x2 (ka/ni) in amount/degree x3 under conditions x4

d:entry.p: non-resultative, not-necessarily causal change]; (cf. cenba which is non-resultative, galfi which is resultative and causal, stika which is non-resultative and causal; stodi, zasni, binxo)

ul.li: x1 is holy/sacred to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group x2

d:entry.p: cf. cevni, krici, latna, pruxi, lijda, sinma)

ul.li: x1 is a hundredth [1/100
1x10**-2] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units)

d:entry.p: cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

ul.li: x1 is an heir to/is to inherit x2 (object/quality) from x3 according to rule x4

d:entry.p: pedantically, inheriting an object should be a sumti-raising (tu'a if non-abstract in x2) of inheriting loka ponse the object - the ownership of the object (= posycerda, posyselcerda for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. jgina)

ul.li: x1 is a morning [dawn until after typical start-of-work for locale] of day x2 at location x3

d:entry.p: this morning (= cabdeicerni); tomorrow morning (= bavlamcerni); yesterday morning (= prulamcerni, prulamdeicerni)](cf. vanci, murse, tcika)

ul.li: x1 is an expert/pro/has prowess in/is skilled at x2 (event/activity) by standard x3

d:entry.p: also competent, skilled]; (cf. djuno, stati, kakne)

ul.li: x1 is a/the god/deity of people(s)/religion x2 with dominion over x3 [sphere]
x1 is divine

d:entry.p: also divinity; x2 religion refers to the religious community as a mass]; (cf. censa, krici, lijda, malsi)

ul.li: x1 [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur
(intransitive verb)
x1 is a work of fiction about plot/theme/subject x2/under convention x2 by author x3

d:entry.p: also story, lie, untrue]; (cf. cukta, lisri, prosa, fatci, jitfa, jetnu, xanri)

ul.li: x1 (property - ka) is a flaw/fault/defect in x2 causing x3

d:entry.p: cf. cikre, srera, fenra, fliba, prane)

ul.li: x1 is a wedge [shape/form/tool] of material x2
x1 (event/state) confuses/baffles x2 [observer] due to [confusing] property x3 (ka)
digit/number: 3 (digit)
x1 is blood/vital fluid of organism x2
x1 is cyan/turquoise/greenish-blue [color adjective]

d:entry.p: cf. skari, blabi, xekri, kandi, carmi, crino, blanu)

ul.li: x1 is food/feed/nutriment for x2
x1 is edible/gives nutrition to x2

d:entry.p: cf. citka, nitcu, pinxe, xagji, cpina)

ul.li: x1 is a/the knee/elbow/knuckle [hinged joint, body-part] of limb x2 of body x3

d:entry.p: metaphor: a sharp bend/curve] (cf. korcu, jarco, jganu)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of hydrogen (H)
[metaphor: light, flammable]
x1 is an infant/baby [helpless through youth/incomplete development] of species x2
x1 is a/the gland [body-part] secreting x2, of body x3
x2 is a secretion of x1
(adjective:) x1 is awake/alert/conscious
x1 repairs/mends/fixes x2 for use x3

d:entry.p: a repair may be incomplete, fixing only one of the possible uses of x2, hence x3]; (cf. cfila, spofu)

ul.li: x1 (person) explains x2 (event/state/property) to x3 with explanation x4 (du&apos
u)

d:entry.p: explanation x4 is an underlying mechanism/details/purpose/method for x2 (= velcki for reordered places), generally assumed to be non-obvious; metaphorical usage with the various causal relations (i.e. jalge, mukti, krinu, rinka, nibli, zukte) is possible, but the non-obviousness, and the existence of an explainer with a point of view makes this word not a simple expression of cause]; (cf. cipra, danfu, jalge, jinvi, krinu, mukti, nabmi, preti, rinka, sidbo, zukte, tavla)

ul.li: (adjective:) x1 is wild/untamed
x1 is moist/wet/damp with liquid x2
x1 learns x2 (du&apos
u) about subject x3 from source x4 (obj./event) by method x5 (event/process)
x1 is a thread/filament/wire [shape/form] of material x2
x1 (property - ka) is a dimension of space/object x2 according to rules/model x3
x1 is infinite/unending/eternal in property/dimension x2, to degree x3 (quantity)/of type x3

d:entry.p: also everlasting, eternity, (= cimnytei), eternal (= cimnyteikai or temcimni)] (cf. vitno, renvi, munje, fanmo, sisti)

ul.li: x1 (agent) kisses/busses x2 at locus x3
x1 is an oak, a type of tree of species/strain x2
x1 is a lion/[lioness] of species/breed x2

x1 is an insect/arthropod of species x2
[bug/beetle]

d:entry.p: cf. civla, danlu, jalra, jukni, manti, sfani, toldi, bifce)

ul.li: x1 is thin in direction/dimension x2 by standard x3
[relatively short in smallest dimension]

d:entry.p: cf. rotsu, jarki, tordu, cmalu, caxno, plana, jarki)

ul.li: x1 feels emotion x2 (ka) about x3

d:entry.p: also mood/humor (= nuncni)]; (cf. cmavo list ci'o, cumla, jilra, nelci, xendo, ckeji, cortu, jgira, kecti, kufra, manci, prami, steba, zungi, badri, burna, gleki)

ul.li: x1 (abstraction) interests/is interesting to x2
x2 is interested in x1

d:entry.p: use x1 tu'a for non-specific interest in an object; interested in (= selci'i)]; (cf. zdile, kucli, manci, kurji)

ul.li: x1 in activity/state x2 exhibits sexuality/gender/sexual orientation x3 (ka) by standard x4

d:entry.p: also: x1 courts/flirts; x3 could be a ka[gender or role], ka[attraction to a gender], or ka[type of activity], etc.; (adjective:) x1 is sexual/sexy; x1 is flirted with/courted by x2 (= cinfriti, cinjikca)]; (cf. gletu, pinji, plibu, vibna, vlagi)

ul.li: x1 [material] is a paint of pigment/active substance x2, in a base of x3
x1 is a/are tong(s)/chopsticks/pincers/tweezers/pliers [tool/body-part] for x2 to pinch x3
x1 is a bird/avian/fowl of species x2

d:entry.p: cf. datka, gunse, jipci, nalci, pimlu, vofli, xruki, danlu)

ul.li: x1 (process/event) is a test for/proof of property/state x2 in subject x3 (individ./set/mass)

d:entry.p: also examination, proxy measure, validation; (a set in x3 must be completely specified)]; (cf. ciksi, troci, jarco, pajni, saske)

ul.li: x1 loses person/thing x2 at/near x3
x1 loses property/feature x2 in conditions/situation x3

d:entry.p: x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (rare for cirko), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= po'ecri, posyselcri for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. facki, ralte, sisku, claxu, jinga, pleji, canja, sfasa, dapma, binra, mipri)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains cheese/curd from source x2
x1 inscribes/writes x2 on display/storage medium x3 with writing implement x4
x1 is a scribe

d:entry.p: also x3 writing surface]; (cf. papri, penbi, pinsi, tcidu, xatra, pixra, prina, finti for 'author' or specific authorial works, barna, pinka)

ul.li: x1 smiles/grins (facial expression)

d:entry.p: smile/grin at something (= cismyfra)]; (cf. xajmi, cmila, frumu)

ul.li: x1 (mass) system interrelated by structure x2 among components x3 (set) displaying x4 (ka)

d:entry.p: x1 (or x3) is synergistic in x4; also network; x2 also relations, rules; x3 also elements (set completely specified); x4 systemic functions/properties] (cf. cmavo list ci'e, cmima, girzu, gunma, stura, tadji, munje, farvi, ganzu, judri, julne, klesi, morna, tcana)

ul.li: x1 eats/ingests/consumes (transitive verb) x2

d:entry.p: cf. cidja, pinxe, tunlo, xagji, xaksu, batci, gusta, kabri)

ul.li: x1 is young/youthful [relatively short in elapsed duration] by standard x2

d:entry.p: also age (= nilnalci'o); (adjective:) x1 is junior]; (cf. cnino, slabu, verba)

ul.li: x1 is a history of x2 according to x3 (person)/from point-of-view x3
x1 is a season/is seasonal [cyclical interval], defined by interval/property x2, of year(s) x3

d:entry.p: also anniversary (= citsydei, na'arcitsydei), jubilee (= mumnoncitsi); the period of time may be short or long as indicated by x2, and may occur every year or every nth year as indicated by x3 (default every year); (x2 and/or x3 may need metaphorical restriction: djecitsi, pavdeicitsi; also equinox, solstice, time of year]; (cf. cedra, crisa, critu, dunra, ranji, temci, vensa, jbena)

ul.li: x1 is a louse/flea [blood-sucking arthropod] of species/breed x2, parasitic on x3
x1 is strange/weird/deviant/bizarre/odd to x2 in property x3 (ka)

d:entry.p: also alien, mysterious, deviant, queer, unusual, exotic]; (cf. ranxi, rirci, fange, banli)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of rubber/latex from source x2 of composition including x3
x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of coffee from source/bean/grain x2

d:entry.p: brew based on a seed/bean/grain; e.g. also chicory coffee, decaf, postum] (cf. tcati, brewed from a leaf, barja, cakla)

ul.li: x1 has/is characterized by property/feature/trait/aspect/dimension x2 (ka)
x2 is manifest in x

d:entry.p: manifested/property/quality/trait/feature/aspect (= selkai)]; (cf. cmavo list kai, tcaci, tcini)

ul.li: x1 is a bed/pallet of material x2 for holding/supporting x3 (person/object/event)

d:entry.p: cf. kamju, kicne, nilce, palta, cpana, vreta, jubme, stizu, matci, zbepi, palne, sarji)

ul.li: x1 is perilous/dangerous/potentially harmful to x2 under conditions x3

d:entry.p: x1 is a danger/peril to x2]; (cf. te bandu, te kajde, te marbi, se snura, se xalni)

ul.li: x1 ridicules/mocks/scoffs at x2 about x3 (property/event) by doing activity x4 (event)
x1 feels ashamed/mortified/humiliated under conditions x2 before community/audience x3
x1 is a key fitting/releasing/opening/unlocking lock x2, and having relevant properties x3

d:entry.p: also x2 fastener, mechanism; code key (= termifckiku, kiktermifra); x3 is dependent on the type of key, but are those form properties of the key that enable it to serve the function of opening the lock - in the case of a metal key to a padlock, for example, this would be the shaft and teeth]; (cf. stela)

ul.li: x1 (si&apos
o) is a scale of units for measuring/observing/determining x2 (state)

d:entry.p: cf. cmavo list ci'u, gradu, merli, cimde, manri)

ul.li: x1 is related to/associated with/akin to x2 by relationship x3

d:entry.p: cf. cmavo list ki'i, ponse, srana, steci, mapti, sarxe, fange)

ul.li: x1 is grateful/thankful to/appreciative of x2 for x3 (event/property)

d:entry.p: also gratitude (= nunckire or kamckire)]; (cf. cinmo, friti, pluka)

ul.li: x1 is school/institute/academy at x2 teaching subject(s) x3 to audien./commun. x4 operated by x

d:entry.p: also college, university]; (cf. cilre, ctuca, tadni)

ul.li: x1 is a conifer/pine/fir of species/strain x2 with cones x3
x1 is loud/noisy at observation point x2 by standard x3
x1 is long in dimension/direction x2 (default longest dimension) by measurement standard x3

d:entry.p: cf. slabu, condi, ganra, rotsu, tordu, barda, ganra, gutci, minli, rotsu)

ul.li: x1 is without/lacking/free of/lacks x2
x1 is x2-less

d:entry.p: cf. cmavo list cau, cirko, kunti, nitcu, pindi, banzu)

ul.li: x1 is a moss/lichen of species/strain x2 growing on x3
(adjective:) x1 is mossy
x1 (event) is early by standard x2
x1 is polite/courteous/civil in matter x2 according to standard/custom x3
x1 leaves/goes away/departs/parts/separates from x2 via route x3

d:entry.p: also: x1 leaves behind/takes leave of x2]; (cf. litru. canci, vimcu, lebna, litru, muvdu)

ul.li: x1 is a loop/circuit of x2 [material]

d:entry.p: also noose (= skoclupa, saljgeclupa; there is no indication of shape, but merely that the ends join/meet); closed curve defined by set of points (= cuptai)]; (cf. djine)

ul.li: x1 is a mathematics of type/describing x2
x1 is small in property/dimension(s) x2 (ka) as compared with standard/norm x3

d:entry.p: cf. caxno, cinla, jarki, tordu, barda)

x1 is a structure word of grammatical class x2, with meaning/function x3 in usage (language) x4

d:entry.p: x4 may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; x3 and x4 may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) ma'oste); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = ma'orpoi, ma'orselcmi, ma'orselste)]; (cf. gismu, lujvo, gerna, smuni, valsi)

ul.li: x1 (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of x2 to/used-by namer/name-user x3 (person)

d:entry.p: also: x2 is called x1 by x3 (= selcme for reordered places)]; (cf. cmavo list me'e, gismu, tcita, valsi, judri)

ul.li: x1 laughs (emotional expression)

d:entry.p: x1 laughs at x2 (= mi'afra)]; (cf. ckasu, frumu, xajmi, cisma)

x1 belongs to group x2
x1 is amid/among/amongst group x2

d:entry.p: x1 may be a complete or incomplete list of members; x2 is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership]; (cf. ciste, porsi, jbini, girzu, gunma, klesi, cmavo list mei, kampu, lanzu, liste)

ul.li: x1 utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] x2 expressing x3 (property)

ul.li: x1 [value] is a norm/average in property/amount x2 (ka/ni) among x3(s) (set) by standard x4

d:entry.p: also mean, normal, usual; (x3 specifies the complete set)]; (cf. tcaci, fadni, kampu, lakne, tarti, rirci)

ul.li: x1 is a/the neck [body-part] of x2
[metaphor: a relatively narrow point]
x1 (agent) rewards x2 [recipient] for atypical x3 (event/property) with reward/desserts x4

d:entry.p: differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= zanyne'u), punishment, penalty, demerit (= malne'u, sfane'u); x4 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posne'u, posyvelne'u for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. dunda, friti, jerna, jinga, jivna, pleji, sfasa, venfu, prali, dapma)

ul.li: x1 is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity x2 (ka/ni)
x1 is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer x2 in feature x3 (ka) by standard x4
x1 is a novelty

d:entry.p: cf. nuzba, slabu, citno, se djuno)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb)
[metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal]
x1 is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from x2 in frame of reference x3

d:entry.p: also underside, nether]; (cf. dizlo, gapru, galtu, farna, loldi)

d:entry.p: also fetch; accept a gift (= seldu'acpa)]; (cf. punji, lebna, vimcu)

d:entry.p: x1 may be object or event); (cf. se vasru, jbini, zvati, nenri, vreta, ckana, diklo, jibni, lamji, zutse, punji for lay upon, sarji, zbepi)

d:entry.p: cf. klama, litru, bajra, farlu, plipe)

d:entry.p: also demand (= mi'ecpe); x4 is a means of expression (cf. ve cusku): a request may be indicated in speech, in writing, or by an action (e.g. petitions are often in writing, while begging/panhandling may be indicated by an action or even demeanor)]; (cf. pikci, te preti, te frati, se spuda, danfu)

ul.li: x1 is pungent/piquant/peppery/spicy/irritating to sense x2

d:entry.p: also prickly (= pecycpina)]; (cf. vrusi, kukte, cidja, panci, sumne)

ul.li: x1 broadcasts/transmits [using radio waves] x2 via station/frequency x3 to [radio] receiver x4

d:entry.p: also x1 is a broadcaster]; (cf. tivni, benji, tcana)

d:entry.p: also: x3 is the standard of orientation for x2] (cf. sefta, flira, trixe, mlana, pritu, zunle)

ul.li: x1 is a shirt/blouse/top [upper-body garment - not necessarily sleeved or buttoned], material x
x1 (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects x2 from source/area x3
x1 is a bear/ursoid of species/breed x2
x1 is a fairy/elf/gnome/brownie/pixie/goblin/kobold [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion x2

d:entry.p: also orc, giant, demon or devil (when humanoid-form is presumed by the mythos/religion), bugbear, bogeyman]; (cf. ranmi, especially for non-humanoid creatures of myth, lijda)

ul.li: x1 is green/verdant [color adjective]

d:entry.p: cf. skari, blabi, xekri, kandi, carmi, cicna)

ul.li: x1 is a bridge/span over/across x2 between x3 and x4 [unordered, typically destination first]
x1 is summer/summertime [hot season] of year x2 at location x3
x1 is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year x2 at location x3

d:entry.p: cf. citsi, crisa, dunra, vensa, crepu)

ul.li: x1 is a tide [cyclical/periodic expansion] in x2 caused by x3
x1 is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice x2 of body x3
(adjective:) x1 is labial
x1 is a tax/levy/duty on goods/services/event x2 levied against x3 by authority/collector x4

d:entry.p: also custom, toll, tariff, tribute] (cf. pleji, flalu, turni)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of petroleum/oil from source x2
x1 is a shadow/the shade of object x2, made by light/energy source x3
x1 teaches audience x2 ideas/methods/lore x3 (du&apos
u) about subject(s) x4 by method x5 (event)

d:entry.p: also instruct, instructor, educate, educator, teacher, professor, pedagogue; (adjective:) x1/x5 is pedagogical]; (cf. ckule, cilre, tadni)

ul.li: x1 is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]
x1 is a disk/circle/ring

d:entry.p: normally used for a filled-in circle/disk, but emphasis on roundness means that the concept may include 'ring']; (cf. djine, ranji, bolci, tarmi)

ul.li: x1 is a book containing work x2 by author x3 for audience x4 preserved in medium x5

d:entry.p: x1 is a manifestation/container [a physical object or its analogue] of a work/content, not necessarily using paper (= selpapri)]; (cf. cfika, prina, prosa, tcidu, papri)

ul.li: x1 is full/completely filled with x2

d:entry.p: cf. tisna, kunti, mulno, setca, tisna)

ul.li: x1 (event/state/property) is possible under conditions x2
x1 may/might occur
x1 is a maybe

x1 displays humility about x2
x1 is a quantity of millet [grain] of species/strain x2
x1 is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions x2, with probability distribution x3

d:entry.p: also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = cuncu'a, cunselcu'a, cunjdi, cunseljdi; based on "unpredictable")]; (cf. cnici, lakne, funca, kalsa, snuti)

ul.li: x1 is an affair/organized activity involving person(s) x2 (ind./mass)
x1 is x2&apos
s business

d:entry.p: also matter, concern; x2 is engaged in x1 (which is usually an abstraction) (= selcu'u for reordered places)] (cf. jikca, srana)

ul.li: x1 produces x2 [product] by process x3
x1 (agent) lets/permits/allows x2 (event) under conditions x3
x1 grants privilege x2

d:entry.p: sufficient condition (= crutcini), agent that permits a situation (= tcinycru)]; (cf. rinju, banzu, ralte, jimte, jaspu, zifre)

ul.li: x1 is a worm/invertebrate animal of species/breed x2

d:entry.p: also mollusk, snail (= cakcurnu), shellfish (= xaskemcakcurnu, xaskemcakydja); the generalization to invertebrate is because almost all multicellular invertebrates are indeed wormlike]; (cf. since, silka)

ul.li: x1 is pure/unadulterated/unmitigated/simple in property x2 (ka)

d:entry.p: x1 is simply/purely/unmitigatedly/solely x2]; (cf. prane, jinsa, manfo, sampu, sepli, traji, lumci, xukmi)

ul.li: x1 (agent) expresses/says x2 (sedu&apos
u/text/lu&apos
e concept) for audience x3 via expressive medium x

d:entry.p: also says]; (cf. bacru, tavla, casnu, spuda, cmavo list cu'u, bangu, dapma, jufra, pinka)

ul.li: x1 is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] x2, and of material x3

d:entry.p: also boot (= tupcutci)]; (cf. smoka, taxfu, skiji)

ul.li: x1 is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of x2
x1 chooses/selects x2 [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives x3 (complete set)

d:entry.p: also prefer (= nelcu'a)]; (cf. jdice, pajni, nelci)

ul.li: logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 1 (usually restricted)
digit/number: all except n
all but n
(default 1)
x1 is a drawer/file in structure x2, a [sliding compartment] container for contents x3
x1 is a material object enduring in space-time
x1 is a thing
x1 pertains to the Taoist culture/ethos/religion in aspect x2
x1 is a knife (tool) for cutting x2, with blade of material x3

d:entry.p: cf. denci, balre, katna, tunta, forca, smuci, kinli)

ul.li: x1 is a sack/bag with contents x2, and of material x3
x1 fights/combats/struggles with x2 over issue x3 (abstract)
x1 is a fighter/combatant

d:entry.p: use x3 tu'a for fight over an object/objective]; (cf. bradi, gunta, talsa, darlu, fapro, jamna, sonci)

ul.li: x1 is a drum/cymbal/gong [percussion musical instrument] with beater/actuator x2
x1 hangs/dangles/is suspended from x2 by/at/with joint x3

d:entry.p: pendant (= dadja'i); also dependent (original meaning)] (cf. lasna, jorne)

ul.li: x1 is the answer/response/solution/[reply] to question/problem x2

d:entry.p: cf. ciksi, frati, preti, nabmi, spuda for agentive response/reply, cpedu)

ul.li: x1 is an animal/creature of species x2
x1 is biologically animate

d:entry.p: cf. banfi, cinki, cipni, finpe, jukni, respa, since, mabru, bakni)

ul.li: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of smoke/smog/air pollution from source x2

d:entry.p: x2 may be a fire]; (cf. pulce, gapci, sigja, bumru)

ul.li: x1 (force) puts pressure on/presses/applies force to x2

d:entry.p: agentive press/depress (= da'ergau, da'erzu'e)]; (cf. catke, bapli, prina, tinsa)

ul.li: x1 (individual, mass) dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm x2
x1 is a ballistic projectile [e.g. bullet/missile] for firing by [gun/propelling launcher] x2

d:entry.p: also cannonball, catapult stone, shot pellet(s)]; (cf. cecla, renro, jakne)

ul.li: x1 is an island/atoll/key of [material/properties] x2 in surroundings/body x3
x1 is insular
x1 curses/damns/condemns x2 to fate (event) x3

d:entry.p: curse with a specific expression (= dapsku)]; (cf. mabla, dimna, cnemu, sfasa, dunda, cusku, cirko, jdima)

ul.li: x1 is a road/highway to x2 from x3 with route x4 (x2/x3 may be unordered)

d:entry.p: a regularly used, improved-for-use surface for travelling]; (cf. naxle, tcana, pluta, klaji)

ul.li: x1 argues for stand x2 against stand x3
[an opponent is not necessary]

d:entry.p: cf. fapro, jamna, sarji, talsa, sumti, tugni, casnu, damba, bradi, tavla)

ul.li: x1 is far/distant from x2 in property x3 (ka)
x1 shows audacity/chutzpah in behavior x2 (event/activity)
x1 dares to do/be x2 (event/ka)
x1 hits/strikes/[beats] x2 with instrument [or body-part] x3 at locus x4

d:entry.p: cf. bikla, gunta, jenca, tunta, tikpa, janli, jgari, pencu)

ul.li: x1 is a pocket/pouch of/in garment/item x2
x1 wears/is robed/garbed in x2 as a garment of type x3

d:entry.p: x2 need not be intended for use as a garment (unlike taxfu)]; (cf. taxfu)

ul.li: x1 (event) destroys/ruins/wrecks/despoils x2
x1 is destructive

d:entry.p: cf. spofu, xrani, marxa, zalvi, xaksu)

x1 is a duck/[drake] of species/breed x2

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of dirt/soil/earth/ground from source x2 of composition x3

d:entry.p: also: x1 is earthen; x3: composition including x3, which need not be exhaustive of composition]; (cf. kliti, terdi, loldi)

ul.li: x1 is a heap/pile/stack/mound/hill of materials x2 at location x3

ul.li: x1 is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state x2, at location x3, by calendar x4

d:entry.p: time units in x1 are specified as numbers separated by pi'e or are unit values massified with joi); (cf. cmavo list de'i, djedi, jeftu, masti, nanca, tcika)

ul.li: x1 (event) interrupts/stops/halts/[disrupts] x2 (object/event/process) due to quality x3

d:entry.p: also disturbs (one sense)]; (cf. zunti, fanza, raktu, denpa)

ul.li: x1 is electricity [electric charge or current] in/on x2 of polarity/quantity x3 (def. negative)

d:entry.p: (x3, a quantifier, can be expressed as a simple polarity using the numerals for positive and negative ma'u and ni'u); (explicitly) negative (= dutydikca), positive (= mardikca); current (= (sel)muvdikca; again default negative/electron current), charge (= klodikca, stadikca)]; (cf. lindi, xampo, flecu, maksi, tcana)

ul.li: x1 is local to x2
x1 is confined to locus x2 within range x3

d:entry.p: indicates a specific location/value within a range; e.g. a hits b. What is the locality on b that a hits? Thus x1 is associated with a specific narrow region/interval x2 of wider space/range x3]; (cf. cmavo list di'o, jibni, zvati, cpana, nenri, lamji, stuzi, tcila)

ul.li: x1 is regular/cyclical/periodic in property (ka)/activity x2 with period/interval x3

d:entry.p: also uniform; resonant (= dikslicai)]; (cf. slilu, rilti, xutla, manfo, boxna)

x2/x3&apos
[dividend x2 divided by divisor x3], leaving remainder x4

[doom, curse are mabla-forms]

ul.li: x1 is dear/precious/darling to x2
x1 is emotionally valued by x2

d:entry.p: x1 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydirba for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. tcika, kargu, vamji, vajni, pleji, jadni, jemna)

ul.li: x1 radiates/emits x2 under conditions x3

d:entry.p: if desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in x2 (or use lujvo = po'edji)]; (cf. taske, xagji, mukti, nitcu, nelci, pacna, prami, rigni, trina, xebni, xlura)

o)

d:entry.p: also grants; x3 is a receiver (= terdu'a for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydu'a, posyseldu'a for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. benji, muvdu, canja, pleji, vecnu, friti, sfasa, dapma, cnemu, prali)

d:entry.p: also pfennig, paisa, sen, fen, dinar, etc.; x1 is generally a price/cost/value]; (additional secondary, tertiary, etc. subunit places may be added as x4, x5, x6, ...); (cf. sicni, jdini, jdima, vecnu, rupnu, dekpu, gutci, minli, merli, bunda, kramu)

d:entry.p: also shit, crap; agentive wasting (= fesygau, fesyzu'e)]; (cf. xaksu, kalci, pinca)

x1 is feminine

d:entry.p: x1 is creative/inventive]; (cf. cmavo list fi'e, ciska, pemci, zbasu, larcu, specific works of authorship, prosa, skina)

ul.li: x1 is a law specifying x2 (state/event) for community x3 under conditions x4 by lawgiver(s) x5

d:entry.p: x1 is a legality; x2 is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= selfla for reordered places)]; (cf. javni, ritli, zekri, pulji, tinbe)

x1 is a current/flow/river of/in x2 flowing in direction to/towards x3 from direction/source x4

d:entry.p: x1 is a stream of x2; x2 is a fluid [gas or liquid] (= selfle for reordered places); x1 flushes toward x3; flush (= caifle, sukfle)]; (cf. rirxe, senta where no directionality is implied, rinci, xampo, dikca, sakci, gapci, litki, ciblu)

ul.li: x1 fails at doing x2 (state/event)
x1 is a failure at its role in x2

d:entry.p: baffled (= pesfli, jmifli, dafspufli, menfli, among other senses); also x2 ceases/does not complete/fails to continue due to failure on the part of x1]; (cf. cfila, snada, srera, troci, sisti, ranji, denpa, bebna, zunti)

ul.li: x1 is a/the face [head/body-part] of x2
(adjective:) x1 is facial

pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #7 (specified by goi)
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #8 (specified by goi)

x1 reacts/responds/answers with action x2 to stimulus x3 under conditions x4
x1 is responsive

d:entry.p: x3 stimulates x1 into reaction x2, x3 stimulates reaction x2 (= terfra for place reordering); attempt to stimulate, prod (= terfratoi, tunterfratoi)]; (cf. preti, danfu, spuda, cpedu, tarti)

ul.li: x1 forgives x2 for event/state/activity x3
x1 differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike x2 in property/dimension/quantity x3

d:entry.p: also other-than (less common meaning)]; (cf. ranxi, drata, dunli, simsa, vrici)

ul.li: x1 reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect x2
x1 (action) is easy/simple/facile for x2 (agent) under conditions x3
x2 does x1 freely/easily
x1 is a fraction, with numerator x2, denominator x3 (x2/x3)
x1 offers/proffers x2 [offering] to x3 with conditions x4

d:entry.p: (x4 may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posfriti, posyselfriti for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. canja, dunda, rinsa, vecnu, jdima, cnemu, pleji, vitke)

ul.li: x1 frowns/grimaces (facial expression)

d:entry.p: x1 frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to x2 (= frufra)]; (cf. cmila, cisma)

ul.li: x1 is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of x2 in form/medium x3 made by method x4 (event)
x1 (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) x2
x1 is buoyant
x1 (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of x2
(note mabla/zabna not implied)
x1 rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent x2
x1 is rotten/decayed/fermented
x1 is responsible/accountable for x2 (action/resulting state) to judge/authority x3
x1 is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering x2

d:entry.p: cf. pilka, gapru, marbi, drudi, ve botpi, bitmu, calku)

ul.li: x1 is an article/descriptor labelling description x2 (text) in language x3 with semantics x4

d:entry.p: x2 is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description ((x1 with x2) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu]; 'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] (cf. valsi, cmavo)

ul.li: x1 (event) modifies/alters/changes/transforms/converts x2 into x3

d:entry.p: causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= gafygau, gafyzu'e)]; (cf. stika for non-resultative, binxo for not-necessarily causal change, cenba for non-resultative change; zasni)

ul.li: x1 is high/up/upward in frame of reference x2 as compared with baseline/standard height x3

d:entry.p: also upper; x3 is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself]; (cf. gapru, dizlo, cnita, drudi, farna)

ul.li: x1 is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of x2
[metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole]
x1 (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to x2 by x3

d:entry.p: as a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane]; (cf. kalri, pagre, canko, vorme, zunti)

ul.li: x1 is broad/wide in dimension x2 [2nd most significant dimension] by standard x3

d:entry.p: cf. clani, jarki, rotsu, condi, barda, gutci, minli)

ul.li: x1 [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus property x2 (ka) by means x3 under conditions x4

d:entry.p: x1 is sensitive to x2; also feels, spots, perceives, makes out, discerns/recognizes (but only implying reaction without necessarily any significant mental processing); note that the emphasis is on a property which stimulates x1 and is detected (sanji is passive about the sensing, and is not limited to sensory input, as well as presuming some kind of discernment/recognition, while not being concerned with the means of detection); x3 sense/sensory channel]; (cf. pencu, sanji, viska, sumne, tirna, zgana, canci, simlu)

ul.li: x1 is a/the testes/ovary/testicle/scrotum/balls/gonad/stamen/pistil [body-part] of x2, gender x

d:entry.p: egg/sperm/pollen/gamete producing/bearing organ]; (cf. plibu, sovda, pinji, gutra, mabla)

x1 [amount] is the price of x2 to purchaser/consumer x3 set by vendor x4

d:entry.p: x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydi'a, posyseldi'a for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer (friti), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is vecnu or canja; neither is the same as "value" or vamji; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace)]; (cf. canja, friti, janta, jdini, kargu, pleji, dapma, vamji for 'value', ve vecnu for 'cost', canja, fepni, jerna, jinga, pleji, prali, rupnu, sfasa, vamji)

d:entry.p: also: x1 is hopeful of x2; x2 will hopefully occur, as hoped for by x1; the value of x3 is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to x1, and is the basic determinant of whether pacna means 'hope' or 'wish' or 'expect': hoping for objects/states with negligible expectation is "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is "hoping"; when the probability is subjectively near 1, the attitude is described as "expecting"; the value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("li piso'u" to "li piro"); wish (= sotpa'a), hope (= sorpa'a), expect (= sojypa'a)]; (cf. djica)

d:entry.p: also: x1 is even/planar/level]; (x2 is a set of points at least sufficient to define the plane); (cf. xutla, sefta, tapla, karda, boxfo, pinta)

ul.li: x1 (agent) plows/furrows/tills [cuts into and turns up] x2 with tool x3 propelled by x4
x1 is complex/complicated/involved in aspect/property x2 (ka) by standard x3

d:entry.p: also tangled, confused]; (cf. cfipu, banli, sampu, jgena)

ul.li: x1 (event/state) seems pleasant to/pleases x2 under conditions x3

d:entry.p: cf. rigni, cmavo list pu'a, melbi, nelci, prami)

ul.li: x1 is a route/path/way/course/track to x2 from x3 via/defined by points including x4 (set)

d:entry.p: a route merely connects origin/destination, but need not be improved in any way; (x4 is a set of points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly)]; (cf. litru, naxle, tcana, dargu, klaji, ve klama; tadji, zukte for means to a goal, klama, pagre)

ul.li: x1 (force) folds/creases x2 at locus/loci/forming crease(s)/bend(s) x3

d:entry.p: for agentive folding (= plogau, plozu'e); use cardinal-value sumti in x3, or rapli, to indicate multiple folds]; (cf. korcu, cinje, boxfo, boxna)

ul.li: x1 reflects Polynesian/Oceanian (geographic region) culture/nationality/languages in aspect x2
x1 reflects Japanese culture/nationality/language in aspect x2
x1 possesses/owns/has x2 under law/custom x3
x1 is owner/proprietor of x2 under x3

d:entry.p: x3 is generally more important to the concept than commonly accepted for the English equivalent, since the concept is broader when unconstrained, and the nature/interpretation of possession/ownership is very culturally dependent); (cf. ckini, ralte, jitro, steci, srana, tutra, turni, zivle)

ul.li: x1 breaks/fractures/shatters/[splits/splinters/cracks] into pieces x2
x1 [ordered set] is sequenced/ordered/listed by comparison/rules x2 on unordered set x3

d:entry.p: also (adjective:) x1 is serial]; (sets are completely specified); (cf. cmavo list po'i, lidne, liste, cmima)

ul.li: x1 reflects Portuguese culture/nationality/language in aspect x2
x1 is a profit/gain/benefit/advantage to x2 accruing/resulting from activity/process x3

d:entry.p: also (fe) x2 profits from x3 (= selterprali for reordered places); x1 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= selposprali for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. vecnu, cnemu, pleji, jinga, canja, sfasa, jerna, jdima, dunda, zivle)

ul.li: x1 loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards x2 (object/state)

d:entry.p: also: x1 is loving towards x2, x1 is a lover of x2 (one sense), x2 is beloved by x1 (= selpa'i for reordered places)]; (cf. cinmo, xebni, nelci, djica, sinma, pluka, kurji, pendo, speni)

ul.li: x1 is perfect/ideal/archetypical/faultless/flawless/un-improvable in property/aspect x2 (ka)

d:entry.p: also without defect/error]; (cf. manfo, curve, traji, cfila, mulno)

ul.li: x1 spreads/expands over/into x2 from initial state x3

d:entry.p: cf. tcena, kuspe, ranji, fatri, muvdu, benji)

ul.li: x1 is a person/people (noun) [not necessarily human]
x1 displays personality/a persona

d:entry.p: cf. nanmu, ninmu, remna, zukte, sevzi)

ul.li: x1 (quoted text) is a question/query about subject x2 by questioner x3 to audience x4

d:entry.p: cf. nabmi, danfu, ciksi, frati, spuda, cpedu)

ul.li: x1 is wise/sage about matter x2 (abstraction) to observer x3
x1 is a print/impression/image on/in surface x2 of/made by/using tool/press/implement/object x3

ul.li: x1 is to the right/right-hand side of x2 which faces/in-frame-of-reference x3

ul.li: x1 is prose about plot/theme/subject x2 by author x3 for intended audience x4

d:entry.p: non-poetic written text, without intentional rhyme or meter; x2 may be a convention rather than a subject]; (cf. cfika, lisri, cukta, pemci, finti)

ul.li: x1 is a process with inputs x2, outputs/results x3, passing through steps/stages x4

d:entry.p: x2 resource (= selru'e, but also ru'etci, (ru'er-/ruc- or selru'e-/selruc- modifying:) selxaksu, selsabji, livla)]; (cf. cmavo list pu'e, farvi, tadji, grute, tcini)

ul.li: (adjective:) x1 is elastic/springy
x1 is spiritual/pertains to the soul in nature [either energy or being]

demonstrated potential
abstractor: process (event) abstractor

ul.li: x1 is a pulley [tool] for performing action/function x2 rotating on axle x3

d:entry.p: (adjective:) x1 is swollen]; (cf. balji, cmana, plana)

ul.li: x1 is in the past of/earlier than/before x2 in time sequence
x1 is former
x2 is latter

d:entry.p: time ordering only (use lidne otherwise); aorist in that x1 may overlap in time with x2 as long as it starts before, x1 starts before x2 but is continuing during x2 (= cfaprucabna); non-aorist before, i.e. x1 is over/ended before x2 starts (= fampru), x1 is completed before x2 starts (= mulpru)]; (cf. lidne, balvi, cabna, farna)

ul.li: x1 is a garden/tended/cultivated field of family/community/farmer x2 growing plants/crop x3
x1 is a powder of material x2
x1 (action/activity/behavior) is sane/rational by standard x2
x1 is a rabbit/hare/[doe] of species/breed x2
x1 is x2 radian(s) [metric unit] in angular measure (default is 1) by standard x3

d:entry.p: measured in degrees (julra'o); right ascension [astronomical measurement] (= cacryra'o)] (cf. jganu, kilto, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, gutci, litce, megdo, mikri, milti, minli, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

ul.li: x1 is an affix/suffix/prefix/combining-form for word/concept x2, form/properties x3, language x
x1 is located across/on the other side of gap/boundary x2 from x3
x1 is opposite (fi) x3

d:entry.p: also: x1 is over there (across/beyond zo'e); directly across/beyond a boundary/gap, generally at the shortest plausible distance on the other side of the boundary]; (cf. dukti, kuspe, bancu, kruca, cripu, pagre)

ul.li: x1 reflects Iraqi culture/nationality in aspect x2
x1 (object/person/event/situation) troubles/disturbs x2 (person) causing problem(s) x3

d:entry.p: also afflicts, is disruptive to, troublesome; x1/x3 are a care to x2, x2 is troubled by/cares about x1/x3 (= selra'u for reordered places)]; (cf. dicra, fanza, zunti, kurji, xanka)

ul.li: x1 is delicate/fragile/subtle/refined in property x2 (ka)

d:entry.p: easily damaged or rendered less pleasing/pure/effective]; (cf. jdari, ranti, tsali, milxe, kukte)

ul.li: x1 is principal/chief/leader/main/[staple], most significant among x2 (set) in property x3 (ka)

d:entry.p: staple (= ralselpra); general/admiral/president/principal leader (= ralja'a, ralterbe'e; use additional terms to distinguish among these); also primary, prime, (adverb:) chiefly, principally, mainly; (x2 is complete specification of set)]; (cf. vajni, te bende, minde, lidne, jatna, jitro, gidva, midju)

ul.li: x1 retains/keeps/holds x2 in its possession

d:entry.p: cf. cirko, rinju, ponse, jgari, pinfu, stali, curmi)

ul.li: x1 yields/gives way/surrenders to x2 (force/agent) under conditions x3

d:entry.p: cf. jdari, renvi, ranti, se bapli)

ul.li: x1 is a/the body organ [body-part] of body/species x2 performing function x3
x1 (event/state) continues/persists over interval x2
x1 (property - ka) is continuous over x2

d:entry.p: cf. temci, kuspe, renvi, cedra, citsi, manfo, vitci, cukla, fliba, preja, tcena)

ul.li: x1 is a myth/legend, a culturally significant story about x2 in mythos x3 of culture x4

d:entry.p: also: x1 is mythical/fairy tale; used adjectivally for non-humanoid creatures (= ramda'u) of story/myth/legend/religion, e.g. dragon; fairy tale (= veryranmi)]; (cf. lijda, lisri, crida)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of bronze of composition including x2
x1 is soft/malleable/moldable/yielding to force x2 in conditions x3

d:entry.p: cf. ralci, jdari, lakse, randa, gradu)

ul.li: x1 is natural/spontaneous/instinctive, not [consciously] caused by person(s)
x1 is a rat of species/breed x2
x1 is an atom of element/atomic number x2 of isotope number/atomic weight x3

d:entry.p: cf. kantu for a basic unit of a property or activity; selci for a basic physical subunit, generally of a mass)

ul.li: digit/number: 2 (digit)
x1 is a/the tail/appendix [body-part] of x2
[metaphor: trailing, following portion/appendage]

d:entry.p: cf. nalci, pimlu, se lidne, trixe, birka, jimca)

x1 is a human/human being/man (non-specific gender-free sense)
(adjective:) x1 is human
x1 throws/launches/casts/hurls x2 to/at/in direction x3 (propulsion derives internally to x1)
x1 survives/endures/undergoes/abides/lasts/persists through x2 for interval/duration x3

ul.li: x1 is a reptile of species/breed x2
x1 is rich/wealthy in goods/possessions/property/aspect x2
x1 is repugnant to/causes disgust to x2 under conditions x3

d:entry.p: cf. djica, nelci, trina, vamtu, xebni, pluka)

[metaphor: valuable, tarnishing]
x1 (sequence/non-text quote) is a rhythm/beat of music/expressive form x2

d:entry.p: x4 is usually gravity]; (cf. pambe, tisna, setca, flecu, muvdu, ganxo, rirxe)

ul.li: x1 is restrained/held [back]/constrained/kept by restraint x2 against x3 (event)

d:entry.p: also: x2 is a restraint/binding for x1, x2 keeps/restrains/holds [back]/constrains x1 from x3 (= selri'u for reordered places); agentive restraint (= ri'urgau, ri'urzu'e)]; (cf. zifre, ralte, pinfu, kavbu, fanta, jgari, jimte, bapli, curmi, kluza, tagji)

ul.li: x1 (event/state) effects/physically causes effect x2 (event/state) under conditions x3

d:entry.p: x1 is a material condition for x2; x1 gives rise to x2]; (cf. gasnu, krinu, nibli, te zukte, se jalge, bapli, jitro, cmavo list ri'a, mukti, ciksi, xruti)

ul.li: x1 (agent) greets/hails/[welcomes/says hello to]/responds to arrival of x2 in manner x3 (action

ul.li: x1 is a parent of/raises/rears x2
x1 mentors/acts parental toward child/protege x2

d:entry.p: cf. rorci, mamta, patfu, sidju, dzena, famti, verba, bersa)

ul.li: x1 is a river of land mass x2, draining watershed x3 into x4/terminating at x4

d:entry.p: cf. flecu, senta for most metaphorical aspects; daplu, djacu, lalxu, xamsi, rinci, naxle)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of rice [a type of grain] of strain/cultivar x2
x1 is a/the heart [body-part] of x2
[emotional/shape metaphors are NOT culturally neutral]

d:entry.p: (adjective:) x1 is cardiac; emotional 'heart' (= cnise'i)]; (cf. pambe, ciblu)

ul.li: x1 is a rite/ceremony/ritual for purpose/goal x2, by custom/in community x3, with form/rules x4

d:entry.p: also: x1 is formal, [legal]; x1 is 'going through the motions']; x4 constraints/customs; (cf. lijda, malsi, flalu, javni, tcaci, clite, junri)

ul.li: x1 avoids/evades/shuns/escapes/skirts [fate] x2 (event) through action/state x3 (event)

d:entry.p: also detours around, stays away from; (x1 is normally an object, but may be an event)]; (cf. bandu which is not necessarily successful, fanta, which is agentive, se jersi which implies an opposing agent, sisku, kalte, fapro)

ul.li: digit/number: each, all
converts number to an objectively quantified tense interval modifier
defaults to time tense
x1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains rock/stone of type/composition x2 from location x3

d:entry.p: x2: composition including x2, which need not be complete specification];(cf. kunra, jemna, canre)

x1 reflects European culture/nationality/geography/Indo-European languages in aspect x2
x1 engenders/procreates/begets x2 with coparent x3

d:entry.p: cf. grute, gutra, rirni, se panzi, mamta, patfu, tarbi, bersa, ferti, jbena, sovda)

ul.li: x1 is thick in dimension/direction x2 by standard x3
[relatively long in smallest dimension]

d:entry.p: also stout]; (cf. barda, cinla, ganra, clani, condi, plana, gutci, minli)

d:entry.p: roses are not all pink; avoid using for color rose, which might be labyxu'e]; (cf. spati, xunre)

ul.li: x1 is weak/feeble/frail in property/quality/aspect x2 (ka) by standard x3

d:entry.p: cf. carmi, vlipa, tsali, kandi, kandi, milxe)

x1 melts [becomes liquid from solid state] at temperature x2 and pressure x3

d:entry.p: suspension (= pucyteryrunta, pu'exre)]; (cf. litki, mixre, sligu, sudga)

d:entry.p: also pound, rupee, franc, mark, yen; x1 is generally a price/cost/value]; (cf. jdini, sicni, jdima, vecnu, fepni, dekpu, gutci, minli, merli, bunda, kramu)

ul.li: x1 reflects Russian culture/nationality/language in aspect x2
x1 is an artifact
x1 is artificial

ul.li: x1 is a cabin of vehicle x2
x1 is a match [incendiary device] made of x2
x1 (me&apos
o) is the [decimal/binary] equivalent of fractional x2 (me&apos
o) in base x3 (quantity)

ul.li: x1 slides/slips/glides on x2

d:entry.p: x2 is slick/slippery to/for x1 (= selsakli for reordered places)]; (cf. mosra, fulta, skiji, xutla)

ul.li: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of sugar [sweet edible] from source x2 of composition x3

d:entry.p: also sucrose, fructose, glucose, galactose, lactose, etc.; saccharine/aspartame/sugar substitute (basysakta or sakybasti, ticysakta); x3: composition including x3, which need not be complete specification]; (cf. silna, titla)

ul.li: x1 celebrates/recognizes/honors x2 (event/abstract) with activity/[party] x3

d:entry.p: x3 (and nunsla) festival/fiesta/celebration/occasion/fair/[holiday (some senses)]; not limited to the ameliorative interpretation of 'celebrate': funeral (= mrobixsla)]; (cf. sinma, jbena)

ul.li: x1 is sloped/inclined/slanted/aslant with angle x2 to horizon/frame x3

d:entry.p: also steep (= tcesa'o); normally implies non-rectilinear]; (cf. kurfa, tutci)

ul.li: x1 (mass) is a quantity of salad [food] with ingredients/components including x2

d:entry.p: x2 is in x1, an ingredient/part/component of x1]; (cf. mixre, stasu)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of cassava/taro/manioc/tapioca/yam [edible starchy root] of species/strain x2
x1 is simple/unmixed/uncomplicated in property x2 (ka)
x1 is sound produced/emitted by x2

d:entry.p: x2 sounds (intransitive verb)]; (cf. savru, tirna, voksa, siclu, slaka)

ul.li: x1 sings/chants x2 [song/hymn/melody/melodic sounds] to audience x3

d:entry.p: melody (= sagzgi, ralsagzgi), harmony (= saxsagzgi), harmonize/sing harmony (= saxsa'a), song (= selsa'a)]; (cf. pemci, rimni, rilti, siclu)

ul.li: x1 is conscious/aware of x2 (object/abstract)
x1 discerns/recognizes x2 (object/abstract)

d:entry.p: also: x1 knows [of] x2 (one sense); awareness implies some amount of mental processing above and beyond mere sensory detection, and may also be applied to mental relationships that are not detected by the senses]; (cf. menli, morji, ganse, sipna, cikna)

ul.li: x1 stands [is vertically oriented] on surface x2 supported by limbs/support/pedestal x3

d:entry.p: x1 is standing; x1 stands up; x1 is erect/vertical/upright; x1 bows/bends over (= krosa'i, krosa'ibi'o, plosa'i); frame of reference is (approximate) perpendicularity to the surface, and not to a gravity field]; (cf. kamju, sraji, tuple, zbepi, sarji)

ul.li: x1 (mass) is a meal composed of dishes including x2

d:entry.p: x2 is a course/dish of meal x1 (= selsai for reordered places)]; (cf. barja, stasu, gusta, sanso)

ul.li: x1 is a sauce/topping/gravy/frosting for use with x2, containing ingredient(s) including x3

d:entry.p: x3 is in x1, an ingredient/part/component of sauce x1]; (cf. sanmi, mixre, stasu)

ul.li: x1 is an umbrella/parasol shielding x2 from x3, made of material x4, supported by x5
x1 (abstract) is necessary/required for continuing state/process x2 under conditions x3

d:entry.p: also factually necessary, necessity, prerequisite, condition, precondition]; (cf. cmavo list sau, nitcu)

ul.li: x1 supports/holds up/is underpinning of/[helps] x2 against force/opposition x3 with/by means x4

d:entry.p: also aids; (adjective:) x1 is dependable, reliable (such reliability may be transient; this is not the usual sense of 'reliable' or 'dependable'); (x2 is object/event)]; (cf. bradi, darlu, fapro, sidju, tugni, bongu, ckana, cpana, loldi, sanli, selfu)

ul.li: x1 is a spiral/helix/whorl/[vortex] [shape/form] with limits x2, of dimensionality x3
x1 is harmonious/concordant/in agreement/concord with x2 in property x3 (ka)

d:entry.p: cf. satci, panpi, mapti, tugni, ckini)

ul.li: x1 (mass of facts) is science of/about subject matter x2 based on methodology x3

ul.li: x1 [measurement/match] is exact/precise to precision x2 in property/quantity x3 (ka/ni)

d:entry.p: cf. sarxe, dunli, merli, mapti, kancu, mintu)

ul.li: x1 (agent) strokes/rubs/pets x2 with x3
x1 is a noise/din/clamor [sensory input without useful information] to x2 via sensory channel x

ul.li: x1 operates/drives/runs x2 [apparatus/machine] with goal/objective/use/end/function x3

ul.li: 2nd conversion
switch 1st/2nd places
x1 is surface/face [bounded shape/form] of [higher-dimension] object x2, on side x3, edges x4

d:entry.p: also x4 bounds]; (cf. crane, flira, plita, bliku)

ul.li: x1 is a cell/atom/unit/molecule of x2
x1 is an indivisible, most basic subunit of x2

d:entry.p: x2 generally has mass nature); (cf. kantu for properties, activities; ratni, gradu)

ul.li: x1 (agent) serves x2 with service x3 (activity)
x1 is a servant (noun) of x2 performing x3
x1 reflects Semitic [metaphor: Middle-Eastern] language/culture/nationality in aspect x2
