u) is true

d:entry.p: also: x2 is doubtful/dubious/questionable (= selsenpi for reordered places)]; (cf. jinvi, krici, djuno, birti)

ul.li: x1 is a layer/stratum [shape/form] of x2 [material] within structure/continuum/composite x3

d:entry.p: cf. flecu, nenri, rirxe, sepli, snuji, jbini, bitmu, sruri, serti)

ul.li: x1 dreams about/that x2 (fact/idea/event/state)
x2 is a dream/reverie of x1
x1 is apart/separate from x2, separated by partition/wall/gap/interval/separating medium x3

d:entry.p: also aloof (= jiksei); alone (= rolsmisei meaning apart or unlike all others of its kind; pavysei, seirpavmei meaning "only" or "one alone" - do not use when talking about, for example, two people who are alone); x3 space]; (cf. bitmu, snuji, senta, fendi, curve, jinsa, bitmu, marbi)

ul.li: x1 are stairs/stairway/steps for climbing structure x2 with steps x3
x1 (agent) inserts/interposes/puts/deposits x2 into interior x3/into among/between members of x

d:entry.p: insertion need not imply a significant degree of 'filling'; inject (= je'erse'a); syringe/needle (= se'arterje'e, je'erse'atci, jestu'u or tu'urjesni); also pour, inflate, stuff, fill]; (cf. rinci, tisna, punji, jbini, nenri, jmina, culno, kunti, catlu)

ul.li: x1 is a self/ego/id/identity-image of x2

d:entry.p: cf. cmavo list mi, prenu, menli, jgira)

ul.li: x1 is a fly [a small non-stinging flying insect] of species/breed x2
x1 (agent) punishes x2 for infraction x3 (event/state/action) with punishment x4 (event/state)

d:entry.p: also chastise, castigate, chasten, discipline, correct (one sense); also x4 penalty]; (cf. cnemu, pleji, venfu, zekri, canja, dunda, jdima, jerna, kargu, prali, dapma, cirko, jinga)

ul.li: x1 is a sofa/couch (noun)
x1 dives/swoops [manner of controlled falling] to x2 from x3
abstractor: idea/concept abstractor
x1 is x2&apos
s concept of [bridi]
x1 [sound source] whistles/makes whistling sound/note/tone/melody x2

d:entry.p: cf. sance, tonga, sanga, zgike, savru)

ul.li: x1 is a coin/token/is specie issued by x2 having value x3 of composition including x4
x1 (idea abstract) is an idea/concept/thought about x2 (object/abstract) by thinker x3

d:entry.p: also (adjective:) x1 is ideal/ideational]; (cf. ciksi, jijnu, mucti, jinvi, nabmi, pensi, xanri, cmavo list si'o)

ul.li: x1 helps/assists/aids object/person x2 do/achieve/maintain event/activity x3

d:entry.p: cf. cmavo list si'u, rirni, sarji, vipsi, ferti, selfu)

ul.li: x1 is a cigar/cigarette/cigarillo made from tobacco/smokable substance x2 by x3
x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of silk produced by x2
x1 is a portion/quantity of salt from source x2, of composition including x3
x1 seems/appears to have property(ies) x2 to observer x3 under conditions x4

d:entry.p: also: x1 seems like it has x2 to x3; suggest belief/observation (= mlugau, mluti'i); looks like/resembles (= smimlu, mitmlu)]; (cf. catlu, viska, simsa, zgana, ganse, jarco)

ul.li: x1 is similar/parallel to x2 in property/quantity x3 (ka/ni)
x1 looks/appears like x2

d:entry.p: also: x1 is a likeness/image of x2; x1 and x2 are alike; similarity and parallel differ primarily in emphasis]; (cf. dunli, frica, mintu, panra, simlu, vrici)

ul.li: x1 (set) has members who mutually/reciprocally x2 (event [x1 should be reflexive in 1+ sumti])

d:entry.p: members of x1 do to each other/one another x2, and in return do x2; x1 (plural set) do the same thing x2 to each other]; (cf. kampu, mintu)

ul.li: x1 is a snake/serpent of species/breed x2
x1 esteems/respects/venerates/highly regards x2 [object of respect]

d:entry.p: also: x2 is respected/esteemed/celebrated (= selsi'a for reordered places)]; (cf. banli, censa, misno, nelci, prami, salci, jgira)

ul.li: x1 is the trigonometric sine of angle/arcsine x2
x1 is a sign/symbol/signal representing/referring/signifying/meaning x2 to observer x3

d:entry.p: also: x1 signifies x2; (adjective:) x1 is significant/meaningful/of import; signal an action (= sniti'i), connotation (= se sibyti'isni, sibyti'ismu)]; (cf. lerfu, tcita, barna, mifra, smuni)

ul.li: x1 is asleep (adjective)
x1 sleeps/is sleeping
x1 is straight/direct/line segment/interval between x2 and x3
(adjective:) x1 is linear
x1 reflects Syrian culture/nationality in aspect x2
x1 seeks/searches/looks for property x2 among set x3 (complete specification of set)

d:entry.p: if searching for an object or an event, use tu'a in x2]; (cf. cirko, kalte, kavbu, kucli, rivbi, manci, facki)

ul.li: x1 [agent] ceases/stops/halts/ends activity/process/state x2 [not necessarily completing it]

d:entry.p: cf. fanmo, mulno, cfari, denpa, fliba)

ul.li: x1 cites/quotes/refers to/makes reference to source x2 for information/statement x3 (du&apos
u)
x1 is private/personal/privy/[secret/confidential/confined] to x2
x1 is not-public/hidden

d:entry.p: also: x1 is secret (one sense); x2 is in the know/in touch with/privy to x1 (= selsivni for reordered places); exclusion can be expressed by na'e(bo) in x2: excluded/in the dark (= nalselsivni)]; (cf. gubni, mipri)

ul.li: x1 is a skirt/kilt/dress of material x2
x1 is skirted [garment open at the bottom
not legged]

d:entry.p: a skirted garment may be full length (pastu), but must hang below the waist from support above or at the waist]; (cf. taxfu, palku)

ul.li: x1 is a computer for purpose x2
x1 is a pelt/skin/hide/leather from x2
x1 is/appears to be of color/hue x2 as perceived/seen by x3 under conditions x4

d:entry.p: conditions may include lighting, background, etc.]; (cf. blanu, bunre, cicna, cinta, crino, grusi, narju, nukni, pelxu, xunre, zirpu, carmi, kandi, xekri, blabi)

ul.li: x1 tells about/describes x2 (object/event/state) to audience x3 with description x4 (property)
x1 is a ski/skid/skate/runner for surface (of material) x2 supporting skier/skater/sled/cargo x
x1 is a cinema/movie/film about x2 [plot/theme/subject/activity], filmmaker x3, for audience x4

d:entry.p: also motion picture; x2 may be a convention rather than a subject; cartoon/animation (= selxraci'a skina); television/tv show (= tivyskina, regardless of length, factual content, etc.)]; (cf. tivni, vidni, pixra, finti)

ul.li: x1 is cord/cable/rope/line/twine/cordage/woven strands of material x2

d:entry.p: cf. cilta, jgena, marna, bikla, linsi)

ul.li: x1 reflects Gaelic/Scottish culture/nationality/language in aspect x2

d:entry.p: Irish (= sicko'o), Scottish (= sunko'o), Celtic (= dzeko'o), Welsh (= nanko'o), Breton (= fasko'o); since Scottish/Gaelic is only the northern branch of the Celtic tribes, many would prefer a fu'ivla for Celtic; nationalism might also demand a separate fu'ivla for Irish]; (cf. brito, glico)

ul.li: x1 is a groove/trench/furrow [shape/form] in object/surface x2
x1 is old/familiar/well-known to observer x2 in feature x3 (ka) by standard x4

d:entry.p: This can cover both meanings of old. Old in years, i.e. age, can be conveyed through x2 = the world, life, existence (= loi nu zasti); in usage this has been a common default for ellipsis. However slabu is not the opposite of 'young' (= nalci'o, tolci'o), but the opposite of 'new' (= tolni'o); also ancient (= tcesau), age (= nilsau); x2 is used to x1 (= selsau for reordered places); historic/historical (= cirsau, cirselcedra; also vaipru)]; (cf. clani, citno, cnino, se djuno; not the opposite of citno, djuno)

ul.li: x1 is a syllable in language x2
x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of acid of composition x2
(adjective:) x1 is acidic

d:entry.p: x2: composition including x2, which need not be complete specification]; (cf. slari, nimre)

ul.li: x1 is a cylinder [shape/form] of material x2
x1 is sour/tart to observer x2
x1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains plastic/polymer of type/component unit(s) x2
x1 is solid, of composition/material including x2, under conditions x3

d:entry.p: conditions include temperature and pressure]; (cf. runta, litki, gapci, jdari, dunja, pulce, jduli)

ul.li: x1 oscillates at rate/frequency x2 through set/sequence-of-states x3 (complete specification)

d:entry.p: also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and fro, back and forth, reciprocal (motion), rotates, revolves]; (cf. dikni, rilti, morna, desku, janbe, boxna)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of sulfur/brimstone (S)
[metaphor: foul odor, volcanic]
x1 reflects Slavic language/culture/ethos in aspect x2
x1 is a/the muscle [body-part] controlling x2, of body x3
[metaphor: tools of physical power]

d:entry.p: (adjective:) x1/x2/x3 is muscular (different senses)]; (cf. rectu, xadni, zajba)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains onions/scallions of type/cultivar x2
x1 is a mouse of species/breed x2
x1 guesses/conjectures/surmises x2 (du&apos
u) is true about subject x3
[epistemology]

d:entry.p: also: x1 has a hunch that x2 is true; x1 imagines x2 is true; words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place]; (cf. djuno, facki, jijnu, sruma)

ul.li: x1 (source) is quiet/silent/[still] at observation point x2 by standard x3
x1 is a monkey/ape/simian/baboon/chimpanzee of species/breed x2
x1 is a sock/stocking [flexible foot and lower leg garment] of material x2
x1 is a spoon/scoop (tool) for use x2, made of material x3
x1 is a meaning/interpretation of x2 recognized/seen/accepted by x3

d:entry.p: referential meaning (=selsni, snismu)]; (cf. jimpe, sinxa, valsi, tanru, gismu, lujvo, cmavo, jufra)

ul.li: x1 [agent] succeeds in/achieves/completes/accomplishes x2 as a result of effort/attempt/try x3

d:entry.p: also: x1 reaches x2; (adjective:) x1 is successful; x2 (event/state/achievement)]; (cf. fliba, troci, jgira)

ul.li: x1 is to the south/southern side of x2 according to frame of reference x3
x1 is x2 seconds in duration (default is 1 second) by standard x3

d:entry.p: cf. cacra, junla, mentu, tcika, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

ul.li: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of snow
x1 adheres/sticks to x2

d:entry.p: note that x1 is the adhering surface being claimed; x2 need not be sticky]; (cf. tarla, viknu)

ul.li: x1 is a sandwich/layering [not restricted to food] of x2 sandwiched between x3

d:entry.p: cf. midju, nenri, sepli, senta, jbini, bitmu, sruri)

ul.li: x1 is secure/safe from threat x2 (event)

d:entry.p: cf. ckape, kajde, marbi, terpa, xalni, bandu)

ul.li: x1 (event/state) is an accident/unintentional on the part of x2
x1 is an accident
digit/number: 9 (digit)
digit/number: almost all (digit/number)

digit/number: many
digit/number: several
digit/number: few
x1 is a quantity of soya [grain/bean] of species/strain x2
x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali metal of type x2 [default sodium]

d:entry.p: also potassium, lithium, cesium]; [soda] (cf. jilka, jinme)

ul.li: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of a carbonated beverage/soda of flavor/brand x2

d:entry.p: also: soft drink (though this sometimes includes tea and coffee as distinct from alcoholic beverages which are "hard drinks")]; (cf. jilka, jinme)

ul.li: x1 reflects Russian empire/USSR/ex-USSR (Soviet]/CIS culture/nationality in aspect x2
x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of gold (Au)
[metaphor: valuable, heavy, non-reactive]
x1 is the sun of home planet x2 (default Earth) of race x3
(adjective:) x1 is solar

d:entry.p: 'home planet' refers to a planet which is "home" to a race, but not necessarily the original "home" of a species if that species inhabits many worlds]; (cf. gusni, lunra, mluni, plini, santa, terdi, tarci)

ul.li: x1 sows/plants x2 [crop/plants] at/in x3
x1 is a soldier/warrior/fighter of army x2

d:entry.p: cf. bilni, damba, jenmi, xarci, pulji)

ul.li: x1 is a store/deposit/supply/reserve of materials/energy x2 in containment x3

d:entry.p: x3 need not be a container, but could merely be a site/location restriction; e.g. a heap. The sumti indicates how the supply is identified and distinguished from other occurrences of the stored x2 that are not part of the store]; (cf. panka; vreji for information storage; sabji for a store or reserve that is not necessarily tied to a site, banxa, panka)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of sorghum of species/strain x2
x1 is an egg/ovum/sperm/pollen/gamete of/from organism [mother/father] x2

d:entry.p: (poorly metaphorical only due to gender- and species- being unspecified): ovoid, oblate (= pevyso'aseltai, but better: claboi); egg, specifically female (= fetso'a), of a bird (= cpifetso'a, cpiso'a), of a chicken (= jipcyfetso'a, jipcyso'a] (but note that Lojban does not require specificity, just as English doesn't for either milk or eggs; "sovda" is fine for most contexts); [if fertilized, then tsiju or tarbi]; (cf. ganti, gutra, mamta, patfu, rorci, tsiju, lanbi, tarbi; also djine, konju for shape, tarbi)

ul.li: x1 (event/action abstract) surprises/startles/is unexpected [and generally sudden] to x2

d:entry.p: also expectation (= nalspaji), alarm (= tepspaji)]; (cf. manci, jenca, bredi, suksa)

ul.li: x1 (agent) polishes object/surface x2 with polish x3, applied using tool x4
x1 reflects Spanish-speaking culture/nationality/language in aspect x2

d:entry.p: metaphorical restriction to Spain by contrast with xispo (comparable to the distinction between glico and merko/sralo/brito/kadno); Spain (= sangu'e); Spanish dialects spoken in Spain, especially Castillian (= sansanbau)]; (cf. xispo, ketco, mexno, gento)

ul.li: x1 is a plant/herb/greenery of species/strain/cultivar x2

d:entry.p: also (adjective:) x1 is vegetable/vegetal/vegetative]; (cf. genja, grute, gurni, latna, rozgu, stagi, tricu, tsiju, tujli, xruba, xrula, pezli, srasu)

ul.li: x1 is married to x2
x1 is a spouse of x2 under law/custom/tradition/system/convention x3

x1 is a hospital treating patient(s) x2 for condition/injuries/disease/illness x3

d:entry.p: hospice (a place where x2 of spita is lenu mrobi'o = mrospita)]; (cf. bilma, mikce)

ul.li: x1 is broken/inoperable/broken down/non-utile/not usable for function x2

d:entry.p: agentive break, cause to become inoperable (= pofygau, pofyzu'e); accidentally break, as a result of an event, non-agentive (= pofyja'e, nutpo'uja'e)]; (cf. daspo, katna, porpi, se xrani, cikre)

ul.li: x1 bursts/explodes/violently breaks up/decomposes/combusts into pieces/energy/fragments x2

d:entry.p: x3 also answer/reply]; [if x2 is a person/object, it will usually require "tu'a" indicating that the reply/response is to that person/object doing something. "tu'a" may not be needed if the person/object itself is the stimulus, rather than something it is doing];(cf. cusku, preti, nabmi, danfu, frati, cpedu)

ul.li: x1 spits/expectorates x2 [predominantly liquid] from x3 to/onto x4
x1 is vertical/upright/erect/plumb/oriented straight up and down in reference frame/gravity x2
x1 [abrasive/cutting/scratching object/implement] scratches/[carves]/erodes/cuts [into] x2

d:entry.p: cf. guska, katna, mosra, plixa, kakpa (unlike kakpa, sraku does not imply material is removed), spali)

ul.li: x1 reflects Australian culture/nationality/geography/dialect in aspect x2
x1 pertains to/is germane/relevant to/concerns/is related/associated with/is about x2

d:entry.p: also: x1 is a question of/treats of x2; can be symmetric, although x1 is conventionally more specific or constrained in scope than x2]; (cf. cmavo list ra'a, ckini, ponse, steci)

ul.li: x1 is a blade/expanse of grass of species x2
x1 errs in doing/being/making mistake x2 (event), an error under conditions x3 by standard x4

d:entry.p: cf. drani, which is non-agentive, cfila, fliba)

u) is true about subject x3

d:entry.p: words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place]; (cf. smadi, birti)

ul.li: x1 encircles/encloses/is surrounding x2 in direction(s)/dimension(s)/plane x3

d:entry.p: (jinsru =) x1 is a ring/belt/band/girdle around/circling/ringing x2 near total containment in some dimension(s)]; (cf. karli, senta, snuji, vanbi, se nenri, se jbini, bartu, djine)

ul.li: x1 is honest/open/truthfully revealing to/candid/frank with x2 about matter/fact x3

d:entry.p: also straight, straight-forward]; (cf. tcica, jetnu, jitfa, mipri)

ul.li: x1 is the edible x2 portion of plant x3
x1 is a vegetable

d:entry.p: note that fruits and nuts are also vegetables; generally this word will be used for either the general category of edible plants, or for non-fruit vegetables (= nalrutstagi)]; (cf. grute, kobli, narge, sluni, spati, sunga, tamca)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of ceramic made by x2, of composition x3, in form/shape x4

d:entry.p: made of baked clay or other non-metallic solid; x3: composition including x3, which need not be complete specification]; (cf. kliti)

ul.li: x1 remains/stays at/abides/lasts with x2

d:entry.p: cf. vitno, zasni, ralte, stodi, xabju, stuzi, renvi)

ul.li: x1 is a/the stalk/stem/trunk [body-part] of plant/species x2
[metaphor: main support]
x1 steps/treads on/in surface x2 using limbs x3
x1 is a quantity of soup/stew/olla/olio [food] of ingredients including x2

d:entry.p: x2 is in x1, an ingredient/part/component of x1]; (cf. sanmi, mixre, salta, sanso)

ul.li: x1 has a talent/aptitude/innate skill for doing/being x2

d:entry.p: cf. jinzi, certu, rarna, larcu, kakne)

ul.li: x1 feels frustration about x2 (abstraction)
x1 (ka) is specific/particular/specialized/[special]/a defining property of x2 among x3 (set)

d:entry.p: x2 are members/individuals of a subset of x3; object whose association is specific/defining of a subset or individuals (= tecra'a, also cf. cmavo list po'e, [x2 is also special to x1]); also: especially/strongly/specifically associated]; (x3 is completely specified set)]; (cf. srana, se ponse, ckini, tcila, tutra)

ul.li: x1 is a/the head [body-part] of x2
[metaphor: uppermost portion]

d:entry.p: skull (= sedbo'u)]; (cf. drudi, mebri, xedja, besna, flira, mapku)

ul.li: x1 is a lock/seal of/on/for sealing x2 with/by locking mechanism x3
x1 is x2 steradian(s) [metric unit] in solid angle (default is 1) by standard x3

d:entry.p: cf. centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

ul.li: x1 is to the west/western side of x2 according to frame of reference x3
x1 (agent) suggests/proposes idea/action x2 to audience x3
x1 (event) inspires x2 in/among x3

d:entry.p: event which inspires/suggests/is suggestive (= faurti'i, sidyfau)]; (cf. cmavo list ti'i, tcica, xlura)

ul.li: x1 (event) adjusts/regulates/changes x2 (ka/ni) in amount/degree x3

d:entry.p: non-resultative, causal change; agentive adjust (= tikygau, tikyzu'e)]; (cf. cenba which need not be causal, galfi which is causal and resultative, binxo which need not be causal but is resultative, zasni, stodi)

ul.li: x1 is a chair/stool/seat/bench, a piece or portion of a piece of furniture intended for sitting
x1 is constant/invariant/unchanging in property x2 (ka) in response to stimulus/conditions x3

d:entry.p: also stable/consistent/steadfast/firm/steady]; (cf. cenba, stika, stali, vitno, manfo, zasni, tinsa, jdari)

ul.li: x1 is to the east/eastern side of x2 according to frame of reference x3
x1 is a structure/arrangement/organization of x2 [set/system/complexity]

d:entry.p: x2, if a set, is completely specified); (cf. ganzu, morna, ciste, lujvo, greku, gerna)

ul.li: x1 is an inherent/inalienable site/place/position/situation/spot/location of x2 (object/event)

d:entry.p: generally used for normally stationary objects/events, to give their 'permanent' location]; (cf. cmavo list tu'i, jmive, diklo, zvati, tcini, xabju, jibni, judri, lamji, mokca, stali)

ul.li: digit/number: at most (all)
no more than
digit/number: at least (some)
no less than

o) is abstracted/generalized/idealized from x2 [something concrete] by rules x3

x1 is a quantity of/made from/consists of wool [tight curly hair] from animal/species/source x2

d:entry.p: cf. kosta, kumte, lanme, kanba, bukpu, kerfa)

nearby demonstrative it

ul.li: x1 studies/is a student of x2

d:entry.p: thumb (specifically the hand = xantamji), big toe (= jmatamji)]; (cf. degji, tance, xance, jamfu)

ul.li: x1 is cousin to x2 by bond/tie x3
[non-immediate family member, default same generation]

d:entry.p: probably preferred for metaphorical siblings (over bruna)] (cf. dzena, famti, mensi, bruna, tunba)

ul.li: x1 is a board/plank [3-dimensional long flat rectangle] of material x2

(metaphor: similar to nazbi, tamji, degji)

d:entry.p: (adjective:) x1 is lingual]; (cf. moklu, bangu, nazbi, tamji, degji)

x1 is a quantity of tobacco [leaf] of species/strain x2

d:entry.p: a tile is a 3-dimensional object, relatively uniform and significant in the 3rd dimension, but thin enough that its shape in the the other two dimensions is a significant feature; 'city block' is conceptually a tile; polygon (= taplytai or kardytai - shaped like an approximately-2-dimensional block, lijyclupa - a loop composed of lines)]; (cf. bliku, kubli, matci; karda, for which the 3rd dimension is insignificant, bliku, kurfa, matci, plita, tarmi)

d:entry.p: also pattern; x1 is the mathematical or theoretical ideal form, while x2 is an object/event manifesting that form; e.g. circular/circle-shaped (= cukseltai) vs. circle (=cuktai, while cukla alone is ambiguous); model (= ci'ersaptai, saptai, ci'ersmitai, smitai)]; (cf. nejni, morna; te marji for physical shape, tapla, bliku, kubli, kurfa, cukla, mapti, morna, sarlu)

ul.li: x1 (event) uses up/depletes/consumes/[wastes] x2 [resource]

d:entry.p: waste (= fesxaksu, dusxaksu)]; (cf. citka, festi, daspo, livla, pinxe)

ul.li: x1 uses levity/is non-serious/frivolous about x2 (abstraction)
x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of alcohol of type x2 from source/process x3
x1 (person) is panicked by crisis x2 (event/state)
x1 (object/event) is good/beneficial/nice/[acceptable] for x2 by standard x3

d:entry.p: acceptable (= mlixau, norxau, xaurselcru)]; (cf. melbi, xlali, vrude, zabna)

ul.li: x1 is x2 ampere(s) [metric unit] in current (default is 1) by standard x3

d:entry.p: cf. dikca, flecu, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

ul.li: x1 is a sea/ocean/gulf/[atmosphere] of planet x2, of fluid x3
(adjective:) x1 is marine

d:entry.p: also atmosphere (= varxamsi, varsenta)]; (cf. daplu, djacu, lalxu, rirxe, tumla, vacri, zbani, ctaru)

ul.li: x1 is a/the hand [body-part] of x2
[metaphor: manipulating tool, waldo]

d:entry.p: (adjective:) x1 is manual]; (cf. birka, degji, jitro, xlura, jamfu, tamji)

ul.li: x1 is nervous/anxious about x2 (abstraction) under conditions x3
x1 [concept] exists in the imagination of/is imagined by/is imaginary to x2

d:entry.p: also (adjective:) x1 is mental (one sense), x1 is unreal (one sense); in spite of the synonym, note that x2 is imaginary does not imply that it doesn't exist in the real world; the definition is crafted so that one can talk about imaginary things without claiming that they thereby really exist]; (cf. fatci, senva, sucta, zasti, cfika, dacti, menli, sidbo)

ul.li: x1 is an elephant of species/breed x2
x1 is a weapon/arms for use against x2 by x3
x1 is a pig/hog/swine/[boar] [pork/ham/bacon-producer] of species/breed x2

d:entry.p: sow (= fetxarju), boar (= nakyxarju), pork (= xajre'u), piglet (= citxarju)]; (cf. mabru, cange)

ul.li: x1 is stubborn/willfully opposing/resisting x2 about x3 (event/state)

d:entry.p: x2 may be a person, a state or condition, or a force; the essence is willful resistance]; (cf. tinsa, pante, bapli, fapro)

x1 is a/the sweat/perspiration from body x2, excreted by gland(s)/organs x3
x1 is a letter/missive/[note] to intended audience x2 from author/originator x3 with content x4

d:entry.p: cf. notci, which has places in a different order; the emphasis in xatra is on the communication between author and recipient, and not the content, which in a letter may not easily be categorized to a 'subject'; ciska, mrilu, papri)

ul.li: x1 is 1x10**-18 of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units)

1x10**2] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units)

x1 is a horse/equine/[colt/mare/stallion/pony] of species/breed x2

d:entry.p: (adjective:) x1 is equine/equestrian]; (cf. sufti, xasli, kumte)

d:entry.p: also impresses; x4 is alluring (= trivelxlu for place reordering); x3 may be an achieved action/state, or an attempt to perform an action/enter a state)]; (x3 and x4 are normally events or states); (cf. djica, mukti, trina, jitro, sazri, tcica, xance, stidi, kajde, maksi)

d:entry.p: also: mall, marketplace, shopping center, cooperative, bazaar, trading post, mart; the concept is the function of selling/exchanging coupled with a location, and is more oriented to the larger concept of marketplace than the stalls/shops that comprise it, though it does not exclude the latter individual shops (= zaisle); x3 may include both owners/proprietors and customers in some markets, but in most contexts refers only to the operators]; (cf. vecnu, canja, dinju, banxa)

d:entry.p: words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place]; [x1 is physical (one sense)]; (cf. fatci, xanri)
